region. The community of Franklin was recently honored as one of the “50 Best Small Southern Towns.” The area code for Franklin is 270.
18 miles south of Bowling Green, I-65 Exits 2 or 6. The nearest airport is Nashville International, 40 miles south on I-65 (off of I-40).

value: content=I-65 Exit. Eight veteran stars of the Grand Ole Opry and other top names from bluegrass & country music are among the artists scheduled to appear during the first season at James Monroe’s Music Hall and Campground. Indoor musical variety shows every Friday and Saturday night at 7 pm from April through December. Owner James Monroe is the son of Bill Monroe, “The Father of Bluegrass Music.”
name=Kenny Perry’s Country Creek Golf Course
content=I-65 Exit 2. Designed by PGA touring pro Kenny Perry, this par 72 public course is nestled in picturesque countryside. Practice range, pro shop, snack bar.
content=I-65 Exit. Open year-round for simulcast racing and dining. America’s only turf track; features live thoroughbred racing in September.
http://www.redriverrevival.com Red River Meeting and Rendevous

586-7632. October 12-14, 2007. Enjoy living history at the Red River Meeting House; celebrate the commemoration of the "Second Great Awakening" in America in the early 1800's, beginning in Logan Co., KY. Camp in a place of rare beauty and peace. Participate in a variety of camp activities including reenacting the time period of 1800 with period clothing, cooking over open fires, music, games, and traders with wares for sale. There will be church services, history lessons, exhibits, cemetery tours, and various demonstrations. This is a great place and time for children to learn and play. No camp fee; service animals only; no water or electric hookup for modern tents and campers. Firewood and water furnished.

586-0288 or (866) 221-5700. September 7-8, 2007. Fourth Annual Franklin KY Music Festival hosted by Williams and Clark Expedition will again be at the Jim Roberts Community Park under the giant tent, rain or shine so plan to bring your lawn chair and come to Franklin for some great country and bluegrass music. Some of the groups slated to appear in 2007 are Rhonda Vincent, Bobby Osborne, Cherryholmes, Marty Rabon, John Cowan, Steep Canyon Rangers, The James King Band, and hunger Mountain Boys. As the time nears, other acts will be added. The premier sponsor is the Simpson County Vietnam Veterans organization. There will be food and vendors. Both camping hookups and rough camping will be available. The section with hookups fills early. Come in time for the jam sessions on Wednesday and Thursday. Ticket prices: Friday $20, Saturday $25, 2 day ticket $40 Children under 12 with adult free.
1/4 mile north of I-65 Exit 2 on US 31W
http://www.f-schamber.com Southern Kentucky Region Antique Car Show / Arts & Crafts Fair

Car Show: 842-9221 or +1 270 586-3334; Crafts: +1 270 586-7609. September 14 & 15, 2007. 45th Annual Antique Auto Show in conjunction with Festival on the Square. Cruise-in on the square on Friday night begins 6 pm. No admission charge to public Over 100 trophies awarded All entries must be at least 25 years old -1982 and older Arts and Craft Show featuring Quality Handmade Items.
586-7609. Dec. 8, 2007. Activities on the square before and following the Christmas parade: food, fun, entertainment.

+1 270 586-9080. Fine Italian and Mediterranean dining. The building in which Brickyard Cafe is located dates back to the early 1900's. Early occupants were the Franklin Carriage Company and Hatter Hardware. The old hardware sign is now in the bar area. In the main dining room, an old horse-drawn buggy is suspended on the original manually operated lift platform, which transported buggies and carriages to the second and third floor workshops for repair. Franklin's rich local history is combined with the ambiance of cafes in the coastal cities along the Adriatic Sea, so sit back, relax and enjoy the Brickyard Cafe, where the past and present come together for excellent food and hometown hospitality.
content=Country style cooking; Old Country Store has gifts galore. Rocking chairs on the front porch invite one to "set a spell" and enjoy the lovely flowers that surround the restaurant.
content=Smoked b-b-q. Custom catering available. Extra charge for delivery.

content=Franklin's first fast food establishment: opened May 1956; features baby burgers, milk shakes, soft serve ice cream, especially an ice cream cone covered with a chocolate shell called the "Brown Derby"

content=Serving breakfast, lunch buffet. Dinner features "meat and three" as well as steak and sea food. specialties are homemade desserts and homemade yeast rolls. The restaurant has a "Betty Crocker Cookbook" theme including the red and white checked tablecloths! There is also a drive-through.

Fast foods in Franklin include: McDonald's (2), Burger King, Subway (4), Hardees, Captain D's, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, Papa John's, Wendy's (2), Kentucky Fried Chicken, Sonic Drive-In, Waffle House, Krystal, and Chester's Fried Chicken.
The city of Franklin is referred to as
, allowing alcohol sales only by the drink in larger restaurants (seating at least 100). The rest of Simpson County is completely dry.

value: address=396 South Union Rd., South Union, KY 42206

content= Located about 12 mi northwest of Franklin at the Simpson/Logan County line on Hwy 73. Built in 1869 as a business venture for the South Union Shakers, housed a hotel for the "people of the world."; 6 guest rooms that share common area on 2nd floor landing; accommodations include full breakfast; optional evening meals by reservation; available for parties and receptions; weekly rates available; owned and operated by Shaker Museum at South Union.
